content: How can I prepend an integer to the beginning of a list in Python? For example, I want to turn the list [1, 2, 3] into [42, 1, 2, 3] by adding 42 at the beginning.

To prepend an integer to the beginning of a list in Python, you can use the `insert` method or list concatenation. Here are two ways to achieve this:

1. Using the `insert` method:
   ```python
   my_list = [1, 2, 3]
   my_list.insert(0, 42)
   print(my_list)
   ```
   This will output: `[42, 1, 2, 3]`

2. Using list concatenation:
   ```python
   my_list = [1, 2, 3]
   my_list = [42] + my_list
   print(my_list)
   ```
   This will also output: `[42, 1, 2, 3]`

Both methods effectively add the integer `42` to the beginning of the list. Choose the one that best suits your style or needs.
